config_description: Set keep-alive period for streaming This node will send a keep-alive message periodically with this period. If the node does not receive a keep-alive message from the peer for 2 keep-alive cycles the stream session times out and fail Default value is 300s (5 minutes), which means stalled stream times out in 10 minutes by default
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs' is used to set the keep-alive period for streaming. This means that the node will send a keep-alive message periodically with the specified period to maintain the connection with the peer.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a keep-alive task is scheduled in the system. The keep-alive task is scheduled at a fixed rate based on the value of 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs'.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs' configuration option is that it determines how frequently keep-alive messages are sent between nodes. A shorter period may result in more frequent communication between nodes, while a longer period may reduce the frequency of keep-alive messages exchanged. This can affect the overall performance and stability of the streaming sessions in the system.
